channel.title: Project: 2D RPG Game Visual Basic
channel.description:
This is something ive been working on for about a week. It was suppose to be for a final project for programming 2 but the other students in my class barely skim the concept of programming that she decided to cancel it and for anyone who had a project it could be extra credit. I don't plan on developing it past a working map where you can move around and load various maps. I've only got as far to load one map and move the character around on it. I will release the source code when I'm finished with as far as I plan to go, but until then comment on what you see (which is not much).
[img]http://i46.tinypic.com/108dxmx.jpg[/img]
With visual studio in the background:
[URL=http://img413.imageshack.us/i/screenshotwa.jpg/][IMG]http://img413.imageshack.us/img413/2689/screenshotwa.th.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: Project: 2D RPG Game Visual Basic
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

nade:

abraham2119, mwiebelhaus, Nueb35 haters goin hate

Wait…why am I included in that.
Anyways currently im working on so that you can go to different maps and shit and should be done later today so maybe I will post source code then. But as a fair warning it is pretty sloppy code as I have never done anything like this before, but I am cleaning it up some to make it easier to work with. Also there is no comments so…you have to read it all to really understand what is going on.

UPDATE: Ive finished loading map, but you can walk over all the sprites Ive added so far so there is no object collision. But ill release the source code in a bit.

OK: heres the source, its pretty buggy and laggy and it will quite possibly overload your memory in a matter of character movements because of the shitty method of drawing the sprites I used. Proceed at your own risk.

http://www.mediafire.com/file/wjjyyygzggy/C%3A\fakepath\Role%20Playing%20Game%20v2.zip

Read full topic
